$interpreted: Nolva: Whoa~ Why is that so loud?
Aosta: ......
Aosta: That's my monster alarm signal. Whenever a monster comes near the barrier, it activates.
Nolva: M-Monster? Seems pretty broken.
Aosta: Who are you?
Nolva: I'm Nolva Carpenter. I live in the village on the east side of the Prairie. Are you Dr. Clovis?
Aosta: Ho? I see; so you're the one she told me about.
Nolva: Umm...about your assistant, how did she find me?
Aosta: The survivors of the Atlas explosion have a very high possibility of contracting void disease.
Aosta: Therefore, I told Yamitsuki to locate patients using that criterion.
Nolva: But the survivors of Atlas aren't exactly a small group either. Despite that, you were still able to find me. How?
Aosta: Stop wasting time. Tell me more about your void disease now. How did you contract void disease? What are your symptoms?
Nolva: ......

Nolva: My mother was pregnant with me when Atlas was struck. She was caught up in the explosion and died soon after. 
As for me, I was birthed through emergency C-section.
Nolva: I managed to survive but contracted void disease.
Aosta: The mother inhaled the monster's Soul Energy, causing the fetus to contract the disease through indirect infection?
Aosta: Then what about your symptoms?
Nolva: Ever since I was little, I often enter a deep slumber for no apparent reason. I have no control over when I will fall asleep, or when I will wake up.
Nolva: I've been asleep for as little as half-a-day, but also for as long as half-a-year...
Aosta: There's probably someone who takes care of you, right? If not, you wouldn't be able to even live until now.
Nolva: It used to be my grandpa who took care of me...
Aosta: Used to? Oh, so he's already dead?
Nolva: ......
Aosta: And you couldn't say your final farewell to him because you were in your slumber. Am I right?
Nolva: D-Doctor, have you ever lost someone very important to you?
Nolva: Ever since my parents died, grandpa has always been by my side and took care of me.
Nolva: He was an old man, yet he still worked hard to raise me all by himself.  I couldn't even be there to say goodbye to him when his time came...
Aosta: Hmph, that's none of my business.
Nolva: I-I even... told him that I hate him the last time we talked.
Nolva: Can you... can you really cure me?
Aosta: Drink it.
Nolva: Done. What's next?
Aosta: That's it. If anything odd happens, come to me again.
Nolva: ......
Nolva: Then I will leave now.
Nolva: T-Thank you, doctor...
Nolva: W-Well-crafted wooden puppets~ You can purchase one for your kids to play with~
Nolva: Everyone come and take a look; there are a lot of cute puppets here...
Nolva: T-This one's Anna.
Nolva: Little boy, you can buy one and talk with it...
Nolva: See, her eyes will even glow during the middle of the night...
Nolva: Nobody's buying...
Nolva: ...*sigh*...~ That doctor, no idea if he can actually cure me or not...
Nolva: Life in the new village is not going well at all.
Nolva: Grandpa...
Nolva: (Getting sleepy again? No good. I'm all by myself now. I must hang in there. I have to! )
Bandit Leader: Missy, are you new here?
Nolva: ... Y-Yes, I moved to the nearby village around two months ago. However, due to a physical condition, I only started doing business today...
Bandit Leader: There are rules around here, you know! Who agreed to let you do business here?
Nolva: I...I don't know what rules you're talking about...
Bandit Leader: Then I'll tell you about it. First, you need to pay us a protection fee.
Bandit Leader: Then, you need to give us fifty percent of your income every quarter~
Bandit Leader: Finally, you'll...
Bandit Leader: B-Boss!
Nolva: ......
Bandit Goon: How dare you fall asleep in front of our boss!?
Bandit Leader: She's mocking us! Trash her booth!
Nolva: (What's going on? Why is my body moving on its own? Didn't I fall asleep already? How am I still conscious?}
Nolva: (Monster!?)
Old Man: These bandits are so damn unreasonable...
Old Man: Miss, are you alright?
Nolva: (Wait, so he can't see this monster?)
Old Man: Miss, are you... asleep?

Nolva: (I'm already awake! Why can't I control my body?)
(Is this the effect of Dr. Clovis's medicine? )
Nolva: (No good. I have to go see Dr. Clovis!)
Nolva: (Where are you taking me? Let me go!)

Model.Text: Whoa~ Why is that so loud?
That's my monster alarm signal. Whenever a monster comes near the barrier, it activates.
M-Monster? Seems pretty broken.
Who are you?
I'm Nolva Carpenter. I live in the village on the east side of the Prairie. Are you Dr. Clovis?
Ho? I see; so you're the one she told me about.
Umm...about your assistant, how did she find me?
The survivors of the Atlas explosion have a very high possibility of contracting void disease.
Therefore, I told Yamitsuki to locate patients using that criterion.
But the survivors of Atlas aren't exactly a small group either. Despite that, you were still able to find me. How?
Stop wasting time. Tell me more about your void disease now. How did you contract void disease? What are your symptoms?

My mother was pregnant with me when Atlas was struck. She was caught up in the explosion and died soon after. 
As for me, I was birthed through emergency C-section.
I managed to survive but contracted void disease.
The mother inhaled the monster's Soul Energy, causing the fetus to contract the disease through indirect infection?
Then what about your symptoms?
Ever since I was little, I often enter a deep slumber for no apparent reason. I have no control over when I will fall asleep, or when I will wake up.
I've been asleep for as little as half-a-day, but also for as long as half-a-year...
There's probably someone who takes care of you, right? If not, you wouldn't be able to even live until now.
It used to be my grandpa who took care of me...
Used to? Oh, so he's already dead?
And you couldn't say your final farewell to him because you were in your slumber. Am I right?
D-Doctor, have you ever lost someone very important to you?
Ever since my parents died, grandpa has always been by my side and took care of me.
He was an old man, yet he still worked hard to raise me all by himself.  I couldn't even be there to say goodbye to him when his time came...
Hmph, that's none of my business.
I-I even... told him that I hate him the last time we talked.
Can you... can you really cure me?
Drink it.
Done. What's next?
That's it. If anything odd happens, come to me again.
Then I will leave now.
T-Thank you, doctor...
W-Well-crafted wooden puppets~ You can purchase one for your kids to play with~
Everyone come and take a look; there are a lot of cute puppets here...
T-This one's Anna.
Little boy, you can buy one and talk with it...
See, her eyes will even glow during the middle of the night...
Nobody's buying...
...*sigh*...~ That doctor, no idea if he can actually cure me or not...
Life in the new village is not going well at all.
Grandpa...
(Getting sleepy again? No good. I'm all by myself now. I must hang in there. I have to! )
Missy, are you new here?
... Y-Yes, I moved to the nearby village around two months ago. However, due to a physical condition, I only started doing business today...
There are rules around here, you know! Who agreed to let you do business here?
I...I don't know what rules you're talking about...
Then I'll tell you about it. First, you need to pay us a protection fee.
Then, you need to give us fifty percent of your income every quarter~
Finally, you'll...
B-Boss!
How dare you fall asleep in front of our boss!?
She's mocking us! Trash her booth!
(What's going on? Why is my body moving on its own? Didn't I fall asleep already? How am I still conscious?}
(Monster!?)
These bandits are so damn unreasonable...
Miss, are you alright?
(Wait, so he can't see this monster?)
Miss, are you... asleep?

(I'm already awake! Why can't I control my body?)
(Is this the effect of Dr. Clovis's medicine? )
(No good. I have to go see Dr. Clovis!)
(Where are you taking me? Let me go!)
